holidays.name: Dr. Seuss Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the beloved children's author Theodor Seuss Geisel, known for his imaginative characters and rhymes that have inspired generations.
holidays.origin: Established by the National Education Association to honor Dr. Seuss's birthday and promote reading.
holidays.funFact: Dr. Seuss wrote many of his famous books, including 'Green Eggs and Ham,' using only 50 different words!

holidays.name: National Read Across America Day
holidays.description: A day encouraging people of all ages to read and celebrate the joys of reading, often linked to Dr. Seuss Day.
holidays.origin: Created by the National Education Association in conjunction with Dr. Seuss Day as part of a literacy initiative.
holidays.funFact: Schools across America often host reading events and dress up as Dr. Seuss characters on this day.

holidays.name: National Banana Cream Pie Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to indulging in the creamy, dreamy banana cream pie, a classic American dessert.
holidays.origin: A fun food holiday with unclear origins, popularized through food enthusiasts and social media.
holidays.funFact: Banana cream pie typically features a custard made with vanilla pudding and fresh banana slices topped with whipped cream â€“ simple yet irresistible!

holidays.name: Old Stuff Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday encouraging people to appreciate, clean out, or even re-purpose their old belongings rather than constantly pursuing new things.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday born from internet culture to promote mindfulness about consumption and clutter.
holidays.funFact: Old Stuff Day is the perfect excuse to dig out that mysterious box in the attic and uncover nostalgic treasures (or a few dust bunnies).

holidays.funFact: This day often sparks hilarious viral videos and memes imagining pets as little troublemakers with thumbs!
